title: Congratulating 13-year-old writer Alexis Cummings for her inspirational poetry performed at Carnegie Hall
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION congratulating 13-year-old writer Alexis Cummings
for her inspirational poetry performed at Carnegie Hall

WHEREAS,  It  is  incumbent  upon the people of the State of New York to
recognize those individuals within our  midst  who  provide  exceptional
leadership and commitment to human service; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to  congratu-
late  13-year-old  writer  Alexis  Cummings for her inspirational poetry
performed at Carnegie Hall; and
  WHEREAS, Najaya Royal, Samori Covington and Alexis Cummings are  three
inspirational young writers whose determination, drive and dedication to
the  written word, their families, communities and themselves have given
them a love for poetry and desire to share their work with  others;  the
three  poets  are  mentored by Angeli Rasbury, a Brooklyn Public Library
staffer who facilitated weekly poetry workshops with the support of  the
Brooklyn-based  NY  Writes  Coalition,  Griot  Reading  Programs and the
Brooklyn Arts Council; and
  WHEREAS, In 2009, their poems "I am from the Ghetto Brooklyn"  (Najaya
Royal), "When Randa Wears Red" (Samori Covington) and "I'm Smart" (Alex-
is  Cummings) were set to music by composer Gilda Lyons and collectively
titled "Songs from the  F  Train,"  a  commission  from  American  Opera
Projects, Fort Greene Park Conservancy and the Walt Whitman Project; and
  WHEREAS, "Songs from the F Train" premiered in Fort Greene Park during
the  Make  Music  New  York Festival and was performed again at Carnegie
Hall as part of a concert titled "The Music of Georgia Shreve and  Alvin
Singleton";  at  both  events,  the piece was performed by mezzo-soprano
Nicole Mitchell, a Bedford Stuyvesant native; and
  WHEREAS, Alexis Cummings has read her poetry at  venues  such  as  the
Brooklyn  Public Library and during the annual Robert F. Kennedy program
at Bedford Stuyvesant Restoration Corporation; in addition, she has read
at the Billie Holiday Theatre and for the Association of Black Educators
of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Alexis Cummings has attended the monthly  Creating  Art  Club
and  writing  workshops  facilitated by Angeli Rasbury; her key literary
work is "I'm Smart"; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body  to  act  in  accord
with  its  long-standing  traditions,  honoring  the youth of today, and
leaders of tomorrow, whose character and achievements best exemplify the
ideals and values cherished by this great State and Nation; now,  there-
fore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate 13-year-old writer Alexis Cummings  for  her  inspirational
poetry performed at Carnegie Hall; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Alexis Cummings.
